isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE REDUCTION, SINGLE DRIVE AXLES: EATON - LUBRICATION - WHEEL END LUBRICATION

important.para: In cases where wheel equipment is being installed, either new or after maintenance activity, the lube cavities are empty. Bearings and seals must be manually supplied with adequate lubricant or they will be severely damaged before the normal motion of the vehicle can supply lube to the hub ends of the housing ( Figure 73).

svcprocinfo.para: To avoid the risk of premature damage to wheel bearings and seals, they must be "prelubed" any time the wheel equipment is being installed. There are two methods of doing this. The correct method will depend on the type of wheel equipment being used.

svcsubproc.title: Lubrication When Hubs Have No Filler Holes (Preferred Method*)

step1.para: Fill axle with lube through axle housing cover filler hole.
Jack up left side of axle. Maintain this position for one minute to allow lube to flow into wheel ends at right side.
Jack up right side of axle. Maintain this position for one minute to allow lube to flow into wheel ends at left side.
With vehicle level again, add lube through axle housing cover filler hole. The axle should require two additional pints of lube to bring level up to bottom of filler hole.

svcsubproc.para: *The above procedure is the preferred method since it optimizes the lube supply to the wheel end components and axle sump.

svcsubproc.title: Alternate Method of Wheel End Lubrication

step1.para: After the wheel hub seal has been installed, charge the hub cavity with as much axle lubricant as possible.
Prelube the bearings with clean axle lubricant at installation.

note.para: If the hub has no cavity to accept a precharge of axle lube, the bearings can be prepacked with a good quality grease instead of axle lube. However, excess grease should be removed.

caution.para: Exercise caution when mounting a precharged hub and drum assembly to prevent spilling lubricant on the brake linings.

para.emph: Hubs Equipped with Lube Filler Holes

step1.para: Pour a pint of standard axle lubricant into the hub through the cavity filler hole provided.
